poem:
### Malibu Burning

Red tongues lash  
the coastal hills,  
a fervent whisper—  
windswept chaos,  
nature's swift scorn  
on imperfect shores.  
Night's veil torn  
by glowing anger,  
blazing breath.  
Steps retreat,  
wavering shadows—  
hearts tethered  
to charcoal heartlands.  
Skyward ash,  
a reluctant farewell—  
homes adrift  
in the ember sea.
